CHAT.comment: MOT and Chi play well together , though Chi clearly dominates the play. He decides what they will do , and takes pieces from Mot without asking for them. EXP stays in the background , laughing and commenting only in a few instances. There is no serious discussion about the properties of magnets. Mot and Chi , for the most part , spend the time trying to see how many objects the black base or the yellow wand will hold. In one instance where discussion could have easily come into play , when a penny fails to stick to one of the magnets and the Chi says it's not metal , the only explanation given by Mot is that it's a coin. Video does not start until later; transcript until then is solely from audio tape

u.a: video starts here , but actions and objects are hardly visible until later due to poor lighting and focus
camera comes into focus; actions and objects are visible

MOT sits and Chi stands around a round kitchen table; the magnets are on the table; Chi is holding up the black base magnet with several object stuck to the top and sides , and a string of objects dangling from the bottom of the black base

u.a: the flat silver circle is in the middle of the table , the red ball is stuck on top of it; Mot picks up the flat silver circle with the red ball on top to show it to Chi
